```{r}
set.seed(2023)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyverse)

library(data.table)
library(gridExtra)
library(RColorBrewer)


###################
# IMPORT PMD
###################

# pms
load('../../../local_data/codes/create_master/master_pms_df.Rdata')


# subsampling data (if needed)
perc = 3 #percentage of data to subsample
subsample = (nrow(master)/100)*perc
master = master[sample(nrow(master), subsample),]


# labels
library(stringr)
amenities = c("PMS_prox_idx_emp", "PMS_prox_idx_pharma", "PMS_prox_idx_childcare", "PMS_prox_idx_health", "PMS_prox_idx_grocery", "PMS_prox_idx_educpri", "PMS_prox_idx_educsec", "PMS_prox_idx_lib", "PMS_prox_idx_parks", "PMS_prox_idx_transit")

labs = c('Employment', 'Pharmacy', 'Childcare', 'Healthcare', 'Grocery', 'Pri. Educ.', 'Sec. Educ.', 'Library', 'Parks', 'Transit')

g_legend <- function(a.gplot){
  tmp <- ggplot_gtable(ggplot_build(a.gplot))
  leg <- which(sapply(tmp$grobs, function(x) x$name) == "guide-box")
  legend <- tmp$grobs[[leg]]
  legend
}
```

```{r}
# for a specific amenity
# want y: each method, x: cutoff value rug plot
# need df where col 1 is method, col 2 is cutoff value
# ezpz

# for every item in names(cutofflist)

# put all in same list
cutoff_list <- list(cmanual, chdbscan, cmixall, cmclust, cpamkmeans )

names(cutoff_list) <- c("cmanual", "chdbscan", "cmixall","cmclust", "cpamkmeans" )

# Employment
ameni = 1 
# initialize df with first
df_cutof <- cbind(rep(names(cutoff_list)[1], length(cutoff_list[[1]][[ameni]])), log(cutoff_list[[1]][["PMS_prox_idx_emp"]]+0.0001))

# add
for (algo in 2:length(cutoff_list)){
  # add to temporary
  # add to full
  df_cutof <- rbind(df_cutof, cbind(rep(names(cutoff_list)[algo], length(cutoff_list[[algo]][[ameni]])), log(cutoff_list[[algo]][[ameni]]+0.0001)))
}
colnames(df_cutof) <- c('algo', 'cutoff')
df_cutof <- as.data.frame(df_cutof)

# make plot
ggplot(df_cutof,aes(x = as.numeric(cutoff),y = algo)) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][1])+0.0001), ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "lightblue", show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][1])+0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][2])+0.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "grey",show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][2])+0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][3])+0.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "lightblue",show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][3])+0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][4])+0.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "grey",show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][4])+0.0001), xmax = log(1.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "lightblue",show.legend = F)+ 
  geom_point(shape="|",size=4) + labs(title = "Employment", x = "Cutoffs", y = "Method", subtitle = "Each band represents 20% of the DBs")


# all on same line
# ggplot(df_cutof,aes(x = as.numeric(cutoff), y = 0, color = algo))+geom_point(shape="|",size=4) + labs(title = "Employment", x = "Cutoffs", y = "Method")
```

We can see that mclust has a lot more cutoffs that seem uniformely spaced on the log transform. The fourth cutoff for mclust is clost the the cutoffs for pamkmeans and mixall, but the manual cutoff and the hdbscan cutoff do not find a cutoff at that value. The hdbscan only settled on one cutoff, which is different from all other methods: mclust's last cutoff comes the closest to it in its vincinety, but doesn't seem equal. The manual cutoffs seem to all be concentrated within the second group of mclust cutoffs. Whether they are statistically equal or similar is a different question, whose answer cannot be answered with a visual assessment. It makes sense that pamkmenas and mixall find similar cutoffs, as the algorithms are similar. Overall, it seems like for the Employment amenity, the cutoff values are not similar across methods.

```{r}
}
colnames(df_cutof) <- c('algo', 'cutoff')
df_cutof <- as.data.frame(df_cutof)

# make plot
ggplot(df_cutof,aes(x = as.numeric(cutoff),y = algo)) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][1])+0.0001), ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "lightblue", show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][1])+0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][2])+0.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "grey",show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][2])+0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][3])+0.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "lightblue",show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][3])+0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][4])+0.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "grey",show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][4])+0.0001), xmax = log(1.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "lightblue",show.legend = F)+ 
  geom_point(shape="|",size=4) + labs(title = amenities[ameni], x = "Cutoffs", y = "Method", subtitle = "Each band represents 20% of the DBs")
```

Here, all the cutoffs points for the minima method are completely different from all the other cutoff points, as we see them on the left side of the plot. It seems like the HDBSCAN cutoffs are somewhat aligned with some of those from the MCLUST algoritm, which has extra cutoffs that are not aligned with other methods. Again, the pamkmeans singular cutoff is pretty aligned with that of the mixall, but they are not really aligned with any other.

```{r}
  geom_point(shape="|",size=4) + labs(title = amenities[ameni], x = "Cutoffs", y = "Method", subtitle = "Each band represents 20% of the DBs")
```
For Healthcare, the pamkemans and mixall are still similar to each other although not as much as for the past few amenities. They are again not similar to any other method. The first MCLUST cutoff is similar to the third minima cutoff. All other cutoffs are not similar to each other.

```{r}
}

# make plot
ggplot(df_cutof,aes(x = as.numeric(cutoff),y = algo)) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][1])+0.0001), ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "lightblue", show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][1])+0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][2])+0.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "grey",show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][2])+0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][3])+0.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "lightblue",show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][3])+0.0001), xmax = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][4])+0.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "grey",show.legend = F) + 
  geom_rect(aes(xmin = log(as.numeric(cquintiles[[ameni]][4])+0.0001), xmax = log(1.0001),ymin = -Inf, ymax = Inf), alpha = .05, fill = "lightblue",show.legend = F)+ 
  geom_point(shape="|",size=4) + labs(title = amenities[ameni], x = "Cutoffs", y = "Method", subtitle = "Each band represents 20% of the DBs")
```

We see for the first time so far a big disagreement between the pamkmeans and the mixall methods: the former found a lot more cutoffs, almost equidistance from each other (on log scale). The mixall singular cutoff point falls between the fourth and the fifth of the k-means. The 2nd MCLUST custoff is somwhat aligned with the first cutoff of the pamkmeans, the first cutoff of the HDBSCAN, and the first cutoff of the minima method. Any other cutoffs doesn't seem aligned across the methods.

## Barplots
```{r fig.height=10, fig.width=6}
labs = c('Employment', 'Pharmacy', 'Child care', 'Health care', 'Grocery', 'Primary Education', 'Secondary Education', 'Library', 'Parks', 'Transit')
all_cutoffs = list(cquintiles, cmanual, chdbscan, cmixall, cmclust, cpamkmeans)
all_cutoffs = lapply(all_cutoffs, function(x) lapply(x,sort))

approaches = c('Quintiles', 'Min/Max', 'HDBSCAN', 'MixAll', 'MCLUST', 'PAM k-means')
# produce 1 table per amenity
counter = 1
#for (i in amenities){
	#plot list
i = amenities[1]
	t = list()

	#remove NA values
	amen = master[!(is.na(master[,i])),]
 	
 	for (j in 1:length(approaches)){
 		cutoffs = all_cutoffs[[j]]
 		
 		#assign cluster numbers
		clusts = findInterval(amen[,i], cutoffs[[i]]) + 1
	  amen[,approaches[j]] = clusts
 	}
 	
 	#total population
 	population = sum(amen$PMS_DBPOP, na.rm=T)
 	
 	#create plotting dataframe
	df_long_count = amen[,approaches] %>% 
		pivot_longer(cols = everything(), names_to = "variable", values_to = "value") %>% 
		group_by(variable, value) %>% 
		summarize(count = n()) %>% 
		mutate(percent = count / sum(count))
	df_long_pop = tibble()
	for (approach in approaches){
	  summed = amen %>%
	    group_by(!!!syms(approach)) %>%
	    summarize(total = sum(PMS_DBPOP, na.rm=T))
	  percentages = summed %>%
	    mutate(percentage = total / sum(total))
	  percentages$variable = approach
	  names(percentages)[1] = 'value'
	  df_long_pop = bind_rows(percentages, df_long_pop)
	}
  #print(head(df_long_count))
  #print(df_long_pop)
  
  #reassign factor levels for approaches
  df_long_count$variable = factor(df_long_count$variable, levels=rev(approaches))
  df_long_pop$variable = factor(df_long_pop$variable, levels=rev(approaches))
  
	
  #re-assign factor numbers for coloring purposes
  max_n = max(df_long_count$value)
  for (approach in approaches){
    len = max(df_long_count$value[df_long_count$variable == approach])
    df_long_count[df_long_count$variable == approach,'value'] = round(seq(1, max_n, length.out = len))
    df_long_pop[df_long_pop$variable == approach,'value'] = round(seq(1, max_n, length.out = len))
  }
  
  
	#make plot
	t[[1]] = ggplot(df_long_count, aes(y = variable, x = percent, fill = as.factor(value))) +
		geom_col(position = position_fill(reverse = TRUE)) +
		scale_fill_manual(values = brewer.pal(max_n, "YlGnBu")) + 
		xlab('') + ylab('') + guides(fill = 'none') + ggtitle('# of DBs') + 
    theme( 
      panel.grid.major = element_blank(), 
      panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
      plot.margin=unit(c(0,0,0.1,0),"cm"),
      plot.title = element_text(size = 10),
      axis.ticks.y = element_blank(),
      #axis.text.y = element_blank(),
      axis.text.x = element_blank(), #removes x axis labels
      #axis.ticks.x = element_blank() #removes x axis ticks
    )
# 	t[[2]] = ggplot(df_long_pop, aes(y = variable, x = percentage, fill = as.factor(value))) +
# 		geom_col(position = position_fill(reverse = TRUE)) +
# 		scale_fill_manual(values = brewer.pal(max_n, "YlGnBu")) + 
# 		xlab('Proportion') + ylab('') + guides(fill = 'none') + ggtitle('Population') + 
#     theme( 
#       panel.grid.major = element_blank(), 
#       panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
#       plot.margin=unit(c(0,0,0.1,0),"cm"),
#       plot.title = element_text(size = 10),
#       axis.ticks.y = element_blank(),
#       #axis.text.y = element_blank(),
#       #axis.text.x = element_blank(), #removes x axis labels
#       #axis.ticks.x = element_blank() #removes x axis ticks
#     )
	legend_plt = ggplot(df_long_pop, aes(y = variable, x = percentage, fill = as.factor(value))) +
		geom_col(position = "fill") + labs(fill=" ") +
		scale_fill_manual(values = brewer.pal(max_n, "YlGnBu"), labels=c('Least Proximal', as.character(2:(max_n-1)), 'Most Proximal')) + 
	  guides(fill = guide_legend(title.position = "top", label.hjust = 0.5, nrow=1)) + 
		theme(
        legend.direction = "horizontal",
        legend.position = "bottom"
		) 
	
	#arrange in grid
	t[[2]] = g_legend(legend_plt)

	layout_mat = rbind(c(1),
                    c(1),
                    c(1),
                    #c(1),
                    c(2),
                    c(2),
                    c(2),
                    c(2),
                    #c(2),
                    #c(3),
                    c(3) )
	barp = do.call(grid.arrange,list(grobs=t, layout_matrix=layout_mat,top=labs[counter]))
	
	#export
	#ggsave(paste0(labs[counter], "_barplot.png"), barp, dpi = 400, width=8, height=5)
  #counter = counter + 1
#}
```
